snp1.6:2.1: Several of the examples are gendered so I use “man”.
snp1.6:2.3: Reading bhavantaṁ which is the regular form used with Gotama.
snp1.6:2.4: “Cause” or “reason” are not wrong, but they miss the force of the metaphor, which is about going from one state to another.
snp1.6:3.3: Dhammakāmo is apparently always used in this sense.
snp1.6:19.2: Both Norman and Bodhi read dissati, I read dussati.
